basics.name: Sarah Almeida Carneiro
basics.label: Computer Scientist
basics.summary: Computer science PhD candidate focusing on computer vision and applied deep learning. Member of the LIGM laboratory.

work.name: ESIEE Paris (Université Gustave Eiffel)
work.position: Attaché temporaire d'enseignement et de recherche (ATER)
highlights: Research in prediction with deep learning, and AI teaching

work.name: IFP Energies Nouvelles
highlights: Research in prediction with deep learning

awards.title: University’s third place for Best Bachelor in Computer Science Research Award
awards.awarder: Pontifícia Universidade Católica de Minas Gerais

publications.name: Clustering Dynamics for Improved Speed Prediction Deriving from Topographical GPS Registrations
publications.summary: We present a framework that provides a fresh perspective on devising strategies for missing data traffic analysis.

publications.name: Swmlp: Shared weight multilayer perceptron for car trajectory speed prediction using road topographical features
publications.summary: To predict a vehicle's speed, we use the trajectory road topographical features to fit a Shared Weight Multilayer Perceptron learning model. Our results show significant result improvements, both qualitatively and quantitatively.

publications.name: Graph-based supervoxel computation from iterative spanning forest
publications.summary: we propose a new graph-based method for supervoxel generation by using iterative spanning forest framework.

publications.name: Multi-stream deep convolutional network using high-level features applied to fall detection in video sequences
publications.summary: In this work, we propose and evaluate a multi-stream learning model based on convolutional neural networks using high-level handcrafted features as input in order to cope with this situation.

publications.name: Fight detection in video sequences based on multi-stream convolutional neural networks
publications.summary: Therefore, this study aimed to use a deep learning model based on a multi-stream and high level hand-crafted descriptors to be able to address the issue of fight detection in videos.

publications.name: Image Inpainting Based on Local Patch Search Supported by Image Segmentation
publications.summary: Therefore, this study aimed to use a deep learning model based on a multi-stream and high level hand-crafted descriptors to be able to address the issue of fight detection in videos.

teaching.name: IA for Images

teaching.name: Optimization and Introduction to IA

teaching.name: Optimization Algorithms
teaching.summary: Practical problems in mathematical optimization concepts.
